wikipedia_page.main:
Sir George Gunning, 2nd Baronet (1763–1823), of Horton, Northamptonshire, was an English politician.
He was a Member of Parliament (MP) for Wigan 21 June 1800 – 1802, Hastings 1802 – 1806 and East Grinstead 9 March 1812 – May 1812 and 1812 – 1818.

response: * Sir George Gunning, 2nd Baronet (1763–1823), English politician
| October 1812 || rowspan="3" | George Gunning || James Stephen

The second Baronet was Member of Parliament for Wigan, Hastings and East Grinstead while the third Baronet briefly represented Northampton. The seventh Baronet was a Brigadier-General in the British Army. Orlando George Gunning, grandson of Major John Gunning, sixth son of the second Baronet, was also a Brigadier-General in the Army. His son, Sir Orlando Peter Gunning, was knighted for his military and colonial service.

Rev. Sir Henry John Gunning, 4th Baronet
response: Rev. Sir Henry John Gunning, 4th Baronet (17 December 1797 - 30 June 1885) was the son of Sir George Gunning, 2nd Baronet and his wife, Hon. Elizabeth Bridgeman, daughter of Henry Bridgeman, 1st Baron Bradford. Sir Henry inherited the title from his older brother, Sir Robert Gunning, 3rd Baronet on his death in 1862. Up to the point of his inheritance, Gunning was Rector of Wigan in Lancashire.
